content:
Overview
SelfCare Portal helps you manage your server password and Multi Factor Authentication. Enrollment is required to reset or unlock your account.

To log in and enroll:
1. Go to https://Selfcare.acecloudhosting.com
2. Log in with your server username and password
3. A barcode will appear
4. Open Google Authenticator and scan the barcode
   - If scanning does not work, choose manual entry and enter the numbers shown on the screen
5. Enter the one-time passcode generated by the app and select Next
6. Click "Click Here" to complete enrollment
7. Choose a security question, provide the answer, and select Next
8. Enrollment is complete

Forgot Password
- You must have enrolled at least once
- Go to the portal, click "Forgot your password?"
- Enter your username
- Follow the authentication prompts to reset your password

Change Your Server Login Password
1. Log in to the SelfCare Portal
2. Go to Change Password
3. Enter your old password
4. Enter your new password and confirm it
   - Make sure it meets complexity requirements
5. Enter the CAPTCHA and continue
6. Select an authentication method
7. Re-enter your new password
8. Select Reset

Important Notes
- Enrollment is required before you can reset your password
- You'll need Google Authenticator installed on your mobile device
- Keep your security question answer safe - you'll need it for password resets
- Password must meet complexity requirements (mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters)

When C: Drive Shows Red or Disk is Full

If your C: Drive is showing red or you're running low on disk space, **try these cleanup steps FIRST before upgrading**:

Clear Temporary Files
1. Press Windows Key + R
2. Type `temp` and press Enter
3. Select all files (Ctrl + A) and delete them
4. If prompted, skip any files in use

Clear Windows Temp Folder
1. Press Windows Key + R
2. Type `%temp%` and press Enter
3. Select all files (Ctrl + A) and delete them
4. Skip any files that cannot be deleted

Clear Cache Files
1. Open File Explorer
2. Navigate to C:\Users\[YourUsername]\AppData\Local\Temp
3. Delete old files and folders
4. Empty the Recycle Bin

Disk Cleanup Tool
1. Right-click on C: Drive
2. Select Properties
3. Click "Disk Cleanup" button
4. Check all boxes (especially "Temporary files" and "Recycle Bin")
5. Click "Clean up system files" for more options
6. Click OK to delete files

Remove Unnecessary Programs
1. Go to Control Panel > Programs > Programs and Features
2. Uninstall programs you no longer use
3. Focus on large applications you don't need

Check for Large Files
1. Use File Explorer to identify large files
2. Look in Downloads, Documents, and Desktop folders
3. Move or delete files you no longer need

After Cleanup: Check Your Disk Space

1. Open File Explorer
2. Click on "This PC" or "My Computer"
3. Check the C: Drive space indicator

**Note:** If C: Drive is not visible under My Computer, you can check it by:
- Start > Run > Type "C:" > OK

Symptoms
- Cannot connect to RDP server
- "Server not responding" error
- Connection drops frequently
- Extremely slow response times
- Lag while typing or moving mouse

Automated Solution Overview
The AceBuddy chatbot asks diagnostic questions about internet connectivity and RDP error messages, then provides targeted fixes or escalates to NOC/SysAdmin team with all diagnostic information.

For Users (via Chatbot)
1. User initiates chat: "I can't connect to RDP" or "RDP is very slow"
2. Chatbot asks diagnostic questions:
   - "Are you currently connected to the internet? (Yes/No)"
   - "Are you using WiFi or Ethernet?"
   - "Can you see an error message when trying to connect? If yes, what does it say?"
   - "Is this the first time this has happened?"
   - "Can you access other internet services (email, websites)?"

3. Based on responses, chatbot provides one of three paths:

**Path A: Internet Connectivity Issues**
- Error: No internet connection detected
- Solution: 
  1. Restart your WiFi router/modem (power off for 10 seconds)
  2. Wait 30 seconds for it to fully restart
  3. Reconnect to network
  4. Try RDP connection again
- ETA: Immediate
- If fails: "Escalating to NOC team..."

**Path B: RDP Configuration Issues**
- Error: Cannot connect to RDP server / Server not found
- Solution:
  1. Verify correct server address: [Company RDP Server Address]
  2. Ensure you're within office network or VPN connected
  3. Try from different application: Use mstsc command (Windows)
  4. Wait 2-3 minutes and retry (server may be temporarily unavailable)
- ETA: 5-15 minutes
- If fails: "Escalating to NOC team..."

**Path C: Network/Firewall Issues**
- Error: Connection refused / Timeout
- Solution:
  1. Check if firewall is blocking connection
  2. Verify VPN is connected (if required)
  3. Try from different network (mobile hotspot) to test
  4. Contact IT: "Creating support request..."
- ETA: 30-60 minutes with IT support

4. For complex issues, chatbot automatically creates ticket with:
   - All diagnostic questions and answers
   - Error messages captured
   - Network information
   - Suggested priority (high if completely blocked)
   - Suggested troubleshooting steps already attempted

For NOC/SysAdmin Team
1. Receive automated ticket with all diagnostic data
2. Check server status and logs
3. Verify user's IP is whitelisted
4. Check for network connectivity issues
5. Review recent changes to RDP configuration
6. If server issue: Restart RDP service
7. If user issue: Provide remote support or phone guidance

Issue
User needs to set up monitors for Remote Desktop session or switch between single and multi-monitor configurations.

Symptoms
- User wants to use multiple monitors with RDP
- Currently using single monitor, wants multi-monitor
- Multi-monitor not working in RDP session
- Display resolution issues
- Application windows not appearing on correct monitor

Automated Solution Overview
The AceBuddy chatbot identifies whether user needs single or multi-monitor setup, then provides step-by-step configuration instructions tailored to their setup.

For Users (via Chatbot)
1. User initiates chat: "I want to set up multiple monitors" or "Configure my monitor setup"
2. Chatbot asks: "Are you setting up a single monitor or multi-monitor configuration?"

**For Multi-Monitor Setup:**

Solution Steps:
1. Open **Remote Desktop Connection** (search for "mstsc" on your computer)
2. Enter the RDP server address: [Your Company RDP Server]
3. Click **Show Options** (bottom of dialog)
4. Go to the **Display** tab
5. Look for the option: "Use all my monitors for the remote session"
6. **Check this box** to enable multi-monitor
7. You can also set resolution to "Fill my monitors"
8. Click **Connect**

Result: Your Remote Desktop session will now span across all connected monitors.

**Benefits of Multi-Monitor with RDP:**
- Increased workspace and productivity
- Can view multiple applications simultaneously
- Better use of screen real estate
- Improved workflow efficiency

**For Single Monitor Setup:**

Solution Steps:
1. Open **Remote Desktop Connection** (search for "mstsc")
2. Click **Show Options**
3. Go to **Display** tab
4. Uncheck "Use all my monitors for the remote session"
5. Set resolution to preferred single-monitor resolution
6. Click **Connect**

Result: Your Remote Desktop session will use only one monitor.

Monitor Count Guide
- **Single Monitor**: Standard setup, adequate for most tasks
- **Dual Monitor** (2 monitors): Better for QB + communication + web browsing
- **Triple Monitor** (3+ monitors): Advanced setup for power users, specialized workflows

Recommended Configurations by Role
- **Accounting**: Dual monitor (QB on one, documents/email on other)
- **Admin**: Triple monitor (system management, QB, communication)
- **Support**: Dual monitor (ticketing system, customer info)
- **General User**: Single monitor (adequate for most daily tasks)

Troubleshooting Monitor Setup

**Issue: Multi-monitor option not available**
- Solution: Update Remote Desktop client
- Download: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2828362
- Restart RDP connection

**Issue: Only one monitor shows up in RDP**
- Check all monitors are connected and powered on
- Verify all monitors detected by Windows (Settings  Display)
- Restart RDP connection
- May need to disable and re-enable in Display settings

**Issue: RDP session spans monitors incorrectly**
- Adjust monitor positions in Windows Display settings
- Windows  Settings  System  Display  Arrange displays
- Position monitors to match physical layout
- Reconnect RDP after arrangement

**Issue: Performance degradation with multi-monitor**
- Multi-monitor = higher bandwidth requirements
- Consider reducing resolution
- Close unused applications
- Use Ethernet instead of WiFi for better performance
- Reduce remote desktop quality setting

Performance Optimization
For optimal multi-monitor performance:
1. Use Ethernet connection (not WiFi)
2. Keep network bandwidth available
3. Close unnecessary applications
4. Monitor network latency
5. Reduce resolution if experiencing lag

Remote Desktop Quality Settings
- **High Quality**: Slower, more details (local network)
- **Medium Quality**: Balanced (good for most setups)
- **Low Quality**: Fast, reduced details (slow networks)

Expected Outcome
- User can enable/disable multi-monitor in 2-3 minutes
- Configuration persists across sessions
- Increased productivity with multi-monitor
- Clear troubleshooting steps if issues arise

Time Savings
- Before: 15-20 minutes per ticket (detailed explanation)
- After: 2-3 minutes per user (automated setup guide)
- Annual impact: ~2-3 hours saved per support agent

Success Criteria
- User completes configuration in under 5 minutes
- RDP session uses correct monitors after restart
- No performance issues with multi-monitor setup
- User can toggle between single/multi-monitor as needed

Related Topics

- Display Configuration
- Network Optimization
- RDP Performance
- Workspace Optimization

1. Chatbot creates automatic ticket for configuration confirmation
2. If multi-monitor fails: Auto-escalate to IT with system info

If configuration fails after following steps:
1. Verify Remote Desktop client is updated
2. Check if monitors properly detected by Windows
3. Try single monitor first, then enable multi-monitor
4. Escalate to IT support with screenshot of Display settings

Symptoms
- "Printer not found" or "Printer offline" error
- Print job appears in queue but never prints
- Cannot add printer to system
- Printer appears offline in settings
- Print job stuck/pending indefinitely
- Printer not responding to print commands

Automated Solution Overview
The AceBuddy chatbot asks which printer problem the user is experiencing, then provides targeted troubleshooting steps or escalation to IT support.

For Users (via Chatbot)
1. User initiates chat: "My printer is not working" or "Printer offline"
2. Chatbot asks: "What is your printer issue?"
   - Can't find/connect to printer
   - Printer offline
   - Print job stuck/won't print
   - Printer not responding
   - Other issue

---

Solution A: Printer Offline

**Problem**: Printer shows as "Offline" in Windows settings

**Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:**
1. **Restart the printer**:
   - Locate power button on printer
   - Hold button or turn off for 10 seconds
   - Count to 10 while it shuts down
   - Turn back on and wait for startup (30-60 seconds)

2. **Restart your computer**:
   - Save all work
   - Restart Windows completely
   - Wait for full startup
   - Try printing again

3. **Check printer connection**:
   - Verify printer is connected to network (WiFi or Ethernet)
   - Look for WiFi/network icon on printer display
   - Note any error lights or messages on printer

4. **Print a test page**:
   - Windows  Settings  Devices  Printers & Scanners
   - Select your printer
   - Click "Open queue"
   - Right-click  "Printer properties"
   - Click "Print Test Page"
   - Listen for printer response

**If still offline:**
- Printer may need WiFi reconnection
- Check if WiFi password changed
- Restart WiFi router
- Contact IT support: "Escalating to IT team..."

---

Solution B: Print Job Stuck

**Problem**: Print job appears in queue but never prints, blocking other jobs

**Quick Fix - 3 Minutes:**
1. **Clear the print queue**:
   - Windows  Settings  Devices  Printers & Scanners
   - Click on your printer
   - Click "Open queue"
   - Look for stuck print job
   - Right-click on stuck job  "Cancel"

2. **If queue won't clear**:
   - Press **Windows Key + R**
   - Type: `services.msc`
   - Find "Print Spooler"
   - Right-click  "Stop"
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Right-click  "Start"

3. **Restart printer again**:
   - Power off for 10 seconds
   - Power back on
   - Try printing test page

4. **Try printing again**:
   - Open document
   - File  Print
   - Select printer
   - Click "Print"

**If job still stuck:**
- Printer may have hardware issue
- Contact IT support with printer name and model

---

Solution C: Can't Find/Connect to Printer

**Problem**: Printer not appearing in available printers list

**Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:**
1. **Verify printer is on network**:
   - Check printer power
   - Verify printer connected to WiFi or Ethernet
   - Look for network indicator on printer

2. **Add printer to Windows**:
   - Windows  Settings  Devices  Printers & Scanners
   - Click "Add a printer or scanner"
   - Wait 30 seconds for scan
   - Look for your printer in the list
   - Click on it and "Add device"

3. **If printer not found in scan**:
   - Try "The printer that I want isn't listed"
   - Select "Add a printer using an IP address or hostname"
   - Enter printer IP address: **[Check printer settings or ask IT for IP]**
   - Click Next and follow wizard

4. **If still not found**:
   - Printer may need to be reset
   - Restart printer (power off 10 seconds, power on)
   - Wait 1 minute for network connection
   - Try adding again

**If still not available:**
- Printer may need IT configuration
- Contact IT support: "Escalating to IT team..."

---

Solution D: Printer Not Responding

**Problem**: Printer appears connected but doesn't respond to print commands

**Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:**
1. **Verify printer status**:
   - Check printer display screen
   - Look for error lights (red, orange, blinking)
   - Note any error messages

2. **Check for common issues**:
   - **Out of paper**: Refill paper tray
   - **Paper jam**: Open all access doors and remove jammed paper
   - **Toner/ink low**: Replace cartridge if indicated
   - **Door open**: Close all covers and access doors

3. **Power cycle printer**:
   - Turn off for 10 seconds
   - Turn back on
   - Wait for startup complete

4. **Print test page** (from printer menu):
   - Use printer control panel buttons
   - Navigate to "Settings" or "Maintenance"
   - Select "Print Test Page" or "Test Print"
   - If test page prints, printer is working

**If printer still not responding:**
- Hardware may be malfunctioning
- Contact IT support with error messages

---

Printer Information Needed for IT Support
When escalating to IT, provide:
- **Printer model and name**: [Example: HP LaserJet Pro MFP M428]
- **Location**: [Office, floor, room number]
- **Current status**: Offline / Not found / Not responding / Stuck job
- **Error messages**: Any messages displayed on printer
- **Steps already tried**: What troubleshooting you've completed
- **Print job details**: What document you're trying to print

---

Printer Maintenance Tips
1. **Regular cleaning**: Keep printer clean from dust
2. **Paper quality**: Use appropriate paper type/weight
3. **Toner/ink**: Keep supplies stocked to avoid empty cartridge
4. **Firmware updates**: Check for printer software updates monthly
5. **Network connection**: Ensure stable network for printer

---

Expected Outcome
- 60-70% of printer issues resolved by user in 5-10 minutes
- Remaining issues escalated with complete diagnostic info
- IT receives clear problem description and symptoms
- Minimal back-and-forth for clarification
- User can print within 15-30 minutes

Time Savings
- Before: 15-20 minutes per ticket (troubleshooting guidance)
- After: 5-7 minutes per user (if self-resolved), 3 min (if escalated)
- Annual impact: ~4-6 hours saved per support agent

Success Criteria

- Problem resolved or escalated with complete info
- No repeat tickets for same issue

1. Document all error messages and codes
2. Verify network connectivity
3. Check printer IP address and settings

Symptoms
- Computer running slowly or freezing
- High CPU usage
- High RAM (memory) usage
- Low disk space
- Applications taking long time to load
- System becomes unresponsive periodically
- Fan running loudly
- Programs crashing or quitting unexpectedly

Automated Solution Overview
The AceBuddy chatbot asks users to check their Task Manager for resource usage (CPU, RAM, Disk), then provides targeted solutions based on the readings.

For Users (via Chatbot)
1. User initiates chat: "My computer is running slowly" or "Computer freezing"
2. Chatbot asks: "Let's diagnose the issue. Open Task Manager and check these metrics:"

**Opening Task Manager:**
- Press **Ctrl + Shift + Esc** (fastest method)
- Or: Right-click taskbar  "Task Manager"
- Or: Press **Ctrl + Alt + Delete**  Click "Task Manager"

---

Question 1: CPU Usage
**Chatbot asks**: "What is your CPU usage percentage? (Look at 'Performance' tab, 'CPU')"

**If CPU < 50%**: Normal, not the issue

**If CPU 50-80%**: Moderately high
- Solution:
  1. Look at "Processes" tab
  2. Find processes using high CPU (look at "CPU" column)
  3. If unknown application: Close it
  4. If critical application: Try closing and reopening
  5. Restart computer

**If CPU > 80%**: High (causing slowness)
- Solution:
  1. Go to "Processes" tab
  2. Sort by CPU column (click header)
  3. Close non-critical applications
  4. Close web browsers (Chrome uses significant CPU)
  5. Disable background applications
  6. If issue persists: Restart computer

**If CPU stays high after closing apps:**
- Potential malware or system issue
- Contact IT support
- System may need antivirus scan

---

Question 2: RAM (Memory) Usage
**Chatbot asks**: "What is your RAM usage percentage? (Look at 'Performance' tab, 'Memory')"

**If RAM < 60%**: Normal, not the issue

**If RAM 60-85%**: Moderately high
- Solution:
  1. Close unused applications
  2. Close web browser tabs (each tab uses memory)
  3. Restart programs using high memory
  4. Restart computer

**If RAM > 85%**: Critical (causing system slowness)
- Solution:
  1. Save all work immediately
  2. Close all non-critical applications
  3. Close web browsers completely
  4. Restart your computer
  5. After restart, your memory will be cleared

**If memory usage high even after restart:**
- Application may have memory leak
- Contact IT support
- May need to reinstall problematic application

---

Question 3: Disk Space
**Chatbot asks**: "What is your Disk usage percentage? (Look at 'Processes' tab  click any process  'Performance'  'Disk' OR check disk space in Windows)"

**If Disk < 85%**: Normal, not the issue

**If Disk 85-95%**: Running low on space
- Solution:
  1. Delete temporary files
  2. Remove old/unused applications
  3. Empty Recycle Bin
  4. Archive old documents
  5. Clear Downloads folder
  6. Request disk upgrade from IT

**If Disk > 95%**: Critical (system will slow down severely)
- Solution:
  1. Immediately stop any new file creation
  2. Move large files to external drive (if available)
  3. Delete unnecessary files aggressively
  4. Delete installer files (.exe, .msi files)
  5. Uninstall unused applications
  6. Contact IT: "I need a disk upgrade urgently"

**Check disk space:**
- Click "This PC" in Windows File Explorer
- Right-click your C: drive
- Click "Properties"
- See "Used space" vs "Free space"

---

Complete Diagnostic Process

**User Provides All Three Metrics:**

1. **All normal (CPU <50%, RAM <60%, Disk <85%)**
   - System should be running fine
   - Slowness may be caused by:
     - Network latency
     - Software issue (QB, application bug)
     - Background processes
   - Chatbot suggests: "Restart your computer and monitor performance"

2. **One metric high**
   - CPU high: Close applications, restart
   - RAM high: Close applications, restart
   - Disk high: Delete files, request upgrade

3. **Multiple metrics high**
   - Indicates system is overloaded
   - Solution: Restart computer immediately
   - Close unused applications after restart
   - If problem persists: Contact IT support

---

Recommended Actions by Combination

| CPU | RAM | Disk | Recommended Action |
|-----|-----|------|-------------------|
| Low | Low | Low | Everything normal |
| High | Low | Low | Close CPU-heavy apps, restart |
| Low | High | Low | Close applications, restart |
| Low | Low | High | Delete files, request upgrade |
| High | High | Low | Restart computer |
| High | Low | High | Restart, then delete files |
| Low | High | High | Restart, close apps, delete files |
| High | High | High | Restart immediately, aggressive cleanup needed |

---

Prevention Tips

**For CPU Issues:**
1. Limit number of applications running
2. Keep Windows updated
3. Run antivirus scans regularly
4. Close web browser when not in use

**For RAM Issues:**
1. Restart computer regularly (weekly)
2. Close unused applications
3. Limit web browser tabs (each = memory)
4. Consider RAM upgrade if frequent issues

**For Disk Issues:**
1. Archive old files regularly
2. Delete temporary files monthly
3. Clean up Downloads folder
4. Request upgrade before reaching 90%

---

When to Escalate to IT Support

Contact IT if:
- CPU high after closing all applications
- RAM high immediately after restart
- Disk > 95% and no files to delete
- System still slow after troubleshooting
- Performance affecting work productivity
- Error messages appearing
- System crashes or freezes frequently

---

Expected Outcome
- 60-70% of performance issues resolved by user
- User understands their system resources
- Clear escalation path for complex issues
- IT receives diagnostic data upfront
- Reduced support tickets through prevention

Time Savings
- Before: 20-30 minutes per ticket (remote diagnosis)
- After: 5-10 minutes per user (self-diagnosis)
- Annual impact: ~5-8 hours saved per support agent

Success Criteria
- User can diagnose own performance issue
- System performance improved or escalated appropriately
- IT receives complete diagnostic information
- No repeat tickets for same issue

- Resource Monitoring
- Application Management
- Storage Management
- Computer Maintenance

Troubleshooting
For persistent performance issues:
1. Document resource metrics when issue occurs
2. Note which applications are running
3. Check for recently installed software
4. Verify no malware present
5. Contact IT with complete diagnostic data

   - Won't start / crashes
   - Bank feed not syncing
   - Company file corrupted / won't open
   - Login issues
   - Other issue

---

Solution A: QuickBooks Won't Start / Crashes on Startup

**Problem**: QB won't open or crashes immediately after launching

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Restart your computer**:
   - Save all work in other applications
   - Restart Windows completely
   - Wait for full startup (2-3 minutes)
   - Try opening QuickBooks again

2. **Check internet connection**:
   - QB requires active internet connection
   - Verify WiFi or Ethernet is connected
   - Try visiting a website to confirm connectivity
   - Restart WiFi router if needed

3. **Restart QuickBooks**:
   - Close QB if open
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Open QB again
   - Give it 30 seconds to load

4. **Update QuickBooks**:
   - Open QB
   - Go to **Help** menu
   - Click **Update QuickBooks**
   - Install all available updates
   - Restart QB

5. **Check QB company file**:
   - If QB opens but specific company won't load:
   - Try opening different company file (if available)
   - If other files open: Problem is with that specific file
   - If no files open: Problem is with QB installation

**If QB still won't start:**
- QB installation may be corrupted
- Contact IT support: "QB won't start after troubleshooting"

---

Solution B: Bank Feed Not Syncing

**Problem**: Bank feed not updating or transactions not appearing from bank

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Check feed settings**:
   - Open QB company file
   - Go to **Banking** menu
   - Click **My Bank Feeds**
   - Verify feed is **connected** (green status)
   - If red status: Click **Connect**

2. **Force feed sync**:
   - Go to **Banking**  **My Bank Feeds**
   - Click on the feed
   - Click **Download New Transactions**
   - Wait 1-2 minutes for download

3. **Verify account connection**:
   - Go to **Banking**  **My Bank Feeds**
   - Check that correct bank account is connected
   - Verify login credentials for bank
   - If wrong account: Delete feed and re-add

4. **Check bank settings**:
   - Login to your bank's website
   - Verify QB is authorized to access your account
   - Check if you need to approve QB connection
   - Re-authorize if needed

5. **Wait and try again**:
   - Bank syncs may take 24-48 hours
   - Don't delete duplicate transactions immediately
   - Wait a day to see if transactions appear
   - Then reconcile and delete duplicates

**If feed still not syncing:**
- Bank connection issue
- Chatbot creates support ticket with:
  - Bank name
  - Account type (checking, savings, credit card)
  - Last successful sync date
  - Error messages (if any)

---

Solution C: Company File Corrupted / Won't Open

**Problem**: File appears damaged, won't open, or gives error message

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Try opening from backup**:
   - Ask: Do you have a recent backup of this file?
   - If yes: Open the backup file from backup location
   - Try making it your working file if backup works

2. **Try opening in Safe Mode**:
   - Open QB
   - Open the company file
   - If error appears: Click "Open in Safe Mode"
   - This disables some features but may recover file

3. **Restart QB and computer**:
   - Close QB and all applications
   - Restart computer completely
   - Open QB and try file again

4. **Validate/Rebuild file**:
   - Open QB
   - Go to **File** menu
   - Click **Utilities**  **Validate/Rebuild Data**
   - This checks and repairs file integrity
   - QB will restart and rebuild file

5. **Check company file location**:
   - Verify file is on local hard drive (not shared network)
   - Avoid network file sharing (causes corruption)
   - Make copy to local drive and work from there

**If file still corrupted:**
- File may need professional recovery
- Contact IT support with:
  - File location and name
  - When file became corrupted
  - Any error messages
  - Last backup date

---

Solution D: Login / Authentication Issues

**Problem**: Cannot log in to QB or getting authentication errors

**Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:**

1. **Verify account login**:
   - Confirm username/email is correct
   - Verify password is correct (passwords are case-sensitive)
   - Try resetting password if unsure

2. **Check internet connection**:
   - QB requires internet for login
   - Verify connectivity before attempting login
   - Restart WiFi if needed

3. **Clear cached credentials**:
   - Close QB
   - Go to Windows Settings  Accounts  Credentials Manager
   - Remove any stored QB credentials
   - Restart QB and log in again

4. **Update QB if needed**:
   - Go to **Help**  **Update QuickBooks**
   - Install all updates
   - Sometimes updates fix authentication issues

**If still cannot login:**
- Account may be locked or suspended
- Contact QB support or your account administrator

---

Information Needed for IT Support
When escalating QB issues, provide:
- **QB version and edition**: (Desktop Pro, Premier, Enterprise, Online)
- **Company file name and location**: Where the file is stored
- **Problem description**: What exactly is happening
- **Error messages**: Any error codes or messages displayed
- **When problem started**: Today, this week, etc.
- **Recent changes**: Any updates, network changes, etc.
- **Steps already tried**: What troubleshooting you've done
- **Backup available**: Is there a recent backup

---

Prevention Tips

**For QB Stability:**
1. Keep QB updated with latest patches
2. Restart QB once per week
3. Run verification/rebuild monthly
4. Keep antivirus updated
5. Use uninterruptible power supply (UPS)

**For Bank Feed Reliability:**
1. Reconcile transactions promptly
2. Don't delete unreconciled transactions
3. Update bank credentials if changed
4. Monitor feed status weekly

**For File Integrity:**
1. Store company file on local drive
2. Regular backups (daily minimum)
3. Don't share file over network
4. Use single-user mode when possible
5. Keep QB installed on local drive

---

Expected Outcome
- 50-60% of QB issues resolved by user in 5-15 minutes
- File corruption issues escalated with diagnostic info
- IT receives complete problem description
- Backup restores minimize data loss
- Minimal disruption to accounting work

Time Savings
- Before: 25-40 minutes per ticket (QB troubleshooting)
- After: 10-15 minutes per user (if resolved), 5 min (if escalated)
- Annual impact: ~8-12 hours saved per support agent

Success Criteria
- QB opens and company file loads
- Bank feeds syncing properly
- File integrity verified
- No data loss
- User can continue work

Related Topics
- Data File Management
- Backup and Recovery
- Bank Reconciliation
- Financial Software
- Data Security

Troubleshooting
For persistent QB issues:
1. Check QB system requirements
2. Verify adequate hard drive space
3. Ensure QB is fully updated
4. Run disk cleanup and optimization
5. Contact QB support with complete diagnostic data

Symptoms
- Outlook won't open
- Cannot send emails
- Cannot receive emails
- Email sync not working
- "Cannot connect to server" error
- Login error or authentication failed
- Outlook crashes or freezes
- Email stuck in outbox
- Settings or mailbox empty

Automated Solution Overview
The AceBuddy chatbot asks diagnostic questions about the email issue type and error messages, then provides targeted troubleshooting steps or escalates to IT support with complete diagnostic information.

For Users (via Chatbot)
1. User initiates chat: "My email is not working" or "Outlook problem"
2. Chatbot asks: "What email issue are you experiencing?"
   - Can't send emails
   - Can't receive emails
   - Login/authentication error
   - Outlook crashes or won't open
   - Sync not working
   - Other issue

---

Solution A: Cannot Receive Emails

**Problem**: Emails not coming into Outlook inbox

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Check internet connection**:
   - Verify WiFi or Ethernet is connected
   - Try visiting a website to confirm connectivity
   - Outlook requires active internet to sync

2. **Check account configuration**:
   - Open Outlook
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Select your email account
   - Click **Change** or **Repair**
   - Verify email address and password are correct

3. **Check mailbox connection**:
   - Go to **Send / Receive** tab
   - Click **Send / Receive All**
   - Wait 30 seconds for sync
   - Check if emails arrive

4. **Check inbox rules**:
   - Go to **Home** tab  **Rules**  **Manage Rules & Alerts**
   - Look for any rules that might be blocking emails
   - Verify no rules are redirecting emails to another folder
   - Disable suspicious rules temporarily

5. **Check server settings**:
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Select your email account
   - Click **Change**
   - Verify incoming server settings:
     - Server type: IMAP or POP3 (ask IT which one)
     - Server address: (should be provided by IT)
     - Port: 993 (IMAP) or 995 (POP3)
     - Encryption: SSL/TLS

6. **Restart Outlook**:
   - Close Outlook completely
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Open Outlook again
   - Check inbox again

**If emails still not receiving:**
- Server connection issue
- Server may be down
- Contact IT support

---

Solution B: Cannot Send Emails

**Problem**: Can receive emails but cannot send

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Check outbox**:
   - Open Outlook
   - Go to **Outbox** folder
   - Check if emails are stuck in outbox
   - If emails there: Try **Send / Receive All**

2. **Clear stuck emails**:
   - If email still stuck in outbox:
   - Right-click email
   - Click **Delete**
   - Start fresh with new email

3. **Check outgoing server settings**:
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Select your email account
   - Click **Change**
   - Verify outgoing server settings:
     - SMTP server address: (provided by IT)
     - Port: 587 or 25
     - Encryption: StartTLS or SSL/TLS
     - Authentication: Required (with your email/password)

4. **Verify authentication**:
   - Ensure "Require Authentication" is checked
   - Verify username and password are correct
   - If password recently changed: Update here

5. **Test send**:
   - Create new email to yourself
   - Send it
   - Check if email arrives in inbox in 30 seconds

**If still cannot send:**
- Outgoing server may be down
- Port may be blocked
- Contact IT support: "Cannot send emails from Outlook"

---

Solution C: Login / Authentication Error

**Problem**: Cannot log in to email or getting authentication errors

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Verify credentials**:
   - Confirm email address is correct
   - Confirm password is correct (case-sensitive)
   - Verify no CAPS LOCK is on
   - Try password reset if unsure

2. **Add account again**:
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Click your email account
   - Click **Delete**
   - Confirm deletion
   - Click **New** to add account again
   - Enter email and password
   - Let Outlook auto-configure if possible

3. **Check for old password**:
   - Password recently changed?
   - Outlook may still have old password stored
   - Delete account and re-add with new password

4. **Verify multi-factor authentication (MFA)**:
   - Some accounts require MFA
   - If using MFA: May need app-specific password
   - Contact IT for app-specific password if required
   - Use app password instead of regular password

5. **Clear password cache**:
   - Go to Windows **Control Panel**  **Credential Manager**
   - Remove any stored Outlook/email credentials
   - Restart Outlook
   - Enter credentials fresh

**If still cannot authenticate:**
- Account may be locked
- Contact IT support: "Cannot log in to email"

---

Solution D: Outlook Crashes or Won't Open

**Problem**: Outlook crashes on startup or freezes frequently

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Restart Outlook**:
   - Close Outlook if open
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Open Outlook again

2. **Restart computer**:
   - Save all work
   - Restart Windows completely
   - Open Outlook again

3. **Disable add-ins**:
   - Outlook add-ins can cause crashes
   - Start Outlook in Safe Mode:
     - Hold CTRL while starting Outlook
     - Accept "Safe Mode" prompt
   - If Outlook works in Safe Mode: Problematic add-in exists
   - Contact IT to disable add-in

4. **Check for updates**:
   - Go to **File**  **Office Account**
   - Click **Update Options**  **Update Now**
   - Install all available updates
   - Restart Outlook

5. **Try repairing Outlook**:
   - Go to **Control Panel**  **Programs**  **Programs and Features**
   - Find "Microsoft Office" or "Outlook"
   - Click it and select **Repair** or **Change**
   - Choose **Quick Repair** first
   - If that fails: Try **Online Repair**
   - Restart computer after repair

**If Outlook still crashes:**
- Installation may be corrupted
- Contact IT support: "Outlook keeps crashing"

---

Solution E: Email Sync Not Working

**Problem**: Emails not syncing between devices or recent emails missing

**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:**

1. **Force sync**:
   - Open Outlook
   - Go to **Send / Receive** tab
   - Click **Send / Receive All**
   - Wait 1-2 minutes

2. **Check sync settings**:
   - Go to **File**  **Options**  **Advanced**
   - Look for **Sync and Offline Settings**
   - Verify "Sync Email" is enabled
   - Check sync folder settings

3. **Check folder settings**:
   - Right-click your email account
   - Click **Folder Properties**
   - Verify folder is set to sync
   - For IMAP: Check if specific folders are syncing

4. **Increase sync time range**:
   - Go to **File**  **Options**  **Advanced**
   - Look for sync settings
   - Change to sync "All" emails (not just last 3 months)

5. **Clear offline cache**:
   - Close Outlook
   - Delete outlook.ost file:
     - Go to: C:\Users\[YourUsername]\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Outlook
     - Find outlook.ost file
     - Delete it
   - Restart Outlook
   - Wait for new .ost file to download

**If sync still not working:**
- Server sync issue
- Contact IT support: "Email not syncing"

---

Information Needed for IT Support
When escalating email issues, provide:
- **Email account type**: (Outlook.com, Office 365, Gmail, Corporate, etc.)
- **Device and OS**: (Windows, Mac, which version)
- **Outlook version**: Go to File  Office Account to see version
- **Error message**: Any specific error text
- **When problem started**: Today, this week, after update, etc.
- **Steps already tried**: What troubleshooting completed
- **Other devices**: Does email work on other devices (phone, tablet, etc.)

---

Prevention Tips
1. Keep Outlook updated
2. Maintain strong password
3. Enable MFA if available
4. Disable untrusted add-ins
5. Regularly clear old emails
6. Archive emails for better performance
7. Restart Outlook weekly

---

Expected Outcome
- 60-70% of email issues resolved by user
- Complex issues escalated with diagnostic information
- Email restored within 15-30 minutes for most issues
- Improved productivity with working email
- Prevention tips reduce future issues

Time Savings
- Before: 20-30 minutes per ticket (email troubleshooting)
- After: 8-15 minutes per user (if resolved), 5 min (if escalated)
- Annual impact: ~4-6 hours saved per support agent

Success Criteria
- Email send/receive working
- Outlook opens without crashing
- Emails syncing properly
- User can access all email folders
- No authentication errors

Related Topics
- Email Configuration
- Account Management
- Outlook Settings
- Email Sync
- IT Support Escalation

Troubleshooting
For persistent email issues:
1. Document all error messages
2. Check email works on other devices
3. Verify IT server settings
4. Check firewall blocking email ports
5. Contact IT support with complete diagnostic data

# SelfCare Portal - Password Reset & MFA Guide Overview
SelfCare Portal helps you manage your server password and Multi Factor Authentication. Enrollment is required to reset or unlock your account. Prerequisite
Install Google Authenticator on your mobile device. Enrollment Steps To log in and enroll: Go to https://Selfcare.acecloudhosting.com Log in with your server username and password A barcode will appear

metadata.filename: 01_password_reset.md

content:
Open Google Authenticator and scan the barcode
   - If scanning does not work, choose manual entry and enter the numbers shown on the screen Enter the one-time passcode generated by the app and select Next Click "Click Here" to complete enrollment Choose a security question, provide the answer, and select Next Enrollment is complete Password Reset

metadata.filename: 01_password_reset.md

content:
Portal URL
https://Selfcare.acecloudhosting.com Important Notes
- Enrollment is required before you can reset your password
- You'll need Google Authenticator installed on your mobile device
- Keep your security question answer safe - you'll need it for password resets
- Password must meet complexity requirements (mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters)

metadata.filename: 01_password_reset.md

content: # Disk Storage & Low Disk Space Guide When C: Drive Shows Red or Disk is Full Cleanup Steps to Free Up Space Clear Temporary Files Press Windows Key + R Type `temp` and press Enter Select all files (Ctrl + A) and delete them If prompted, skip any files in use Clear Windows Temp Folder Press Windows Key + R Type `%temp%` and press Enter Select all files (Ctrl + A) and delete them Skip any files that cannot be deleted Clear Cache Files Open File Explorer

metadata.filename: 02_disk_storage_upgrade.md

content: Navigate to C:\Users\[YourUsername]\AppData\Local\Temp Delete old files and folders Empty the Recycle Bin Disk Cleanup Tool Right-click on C: Drive Select Properties Click "Disk Cleanup" button Check all boxes (especially "Temporary files" and "Recycle Bin") Click "Clean up system files" for more options Click OK to delete files Remove Unnecessary Programs Go to Control Panel > Programs > Programs and Features Uninstall programs you no longer use Focus on large applications you don't need

metadata.filename: 02_disk_storage_upgrade.md

content:
Check for Large Files Use File Explorer to identify large files Look in Downloads, Documents, and Desktop folders Move or delete files you no longer need After Cleanup: Check Your Disk Space Open File Explorer Click on "This PC" or "My Computer" Check the C: Drive space indicator **Note:** If C: Drive is not visible under My Computer, you can check it by:
- Start > Run > Type "C:" > OK If You Still Need More Space: Storage Upgrade Plans

metadata.filename: 02_disk_storage_upgrade.md

content:
- Always try cleanup steps first before upgrading
- Regular cleanup helps maintain optimal server performance
- Storage upgrades are processed within 2-4 hours during business hours
- You can downgrade storage later if needed (contact support)
- Backup important data before any storage modifications Need Help? If you need assistance with cleanup or have questions about storage upgrades, contact our support team at 1-855-223-4887 or support@acecloudhosting.com.

metadata.filename: 02_disk_storage_upgrade.md

content:
# RDP Connection Issues - Remote Desktop Problems - AceBuddy Knowledge Base Issue
User cannot connect to Remote Desktop (RDP) or connection is extremely slow/laggy. Symptoms
- Cannot connect to RDP server
- "Server not responding" error
- Connection drops frequently
- Extremely slow response times
- Lag while typing or moving mouse
- Error messages when attempting RDP connection

metadata.filename: 03_rdp_connection_issues.md

content:
Chatbot asks diagnostic questions:
   - "Are you currently connected to the internet? (Yes/No)"
   - "Are you using WiFi or Ethernet?"
   - "Can you see an error message when trying to connect? If yes, what does it say?"
   - "Is this the first time this has happened?"
   - "Can you access other internet services (email, websites)?" Based on responses, chatbot provides one of three paths:

metadata.filename: 03_rdp_connection_issues.md

content:
**Path A: Internet Connectivity Issues**
- Error: No internet connection detected
- Solution: 
  1. Restart your WiFi router/modem (power off for 10 seconds)
  2. Wait 30 seconds for it to fully restart
  3. Reconnect to network
  4. Try RDP connection again
- ETA: Immediate
- If fails: "Escalating to NOC team..."

metadata.filename: 03_rdp_connection_issues.md

content:
**Path B: RDP Configuration Issues**
- Error: Cannot connect to RDP server / Server not found
- Solution:
  1. Verify correct server address: [Company RDP Server Address]
  2. Ensure you're within office network or VPN connected
  3. Try from different application: Use mstsc command (Windows)
  4. Wait 2-3 minutes and retry (server may be temporarily unavailable)
- ETA: 5-15 minutes
- If fails: "Escalating to NOC team..."

metadata.filename: 03_rdp_connection_issues.md

content:
**Path C: Network/Firewall Issues**
- Error: Connection refused / Timeout
- Solution:
  1. Check if firewall is blocking connection
  2. Verify VPN is connected (if required)
  3. Try from different network (mobile hotspot) to test
  4. Contact IT: "Creating support request..."
- ETA: 30-60 minutes with IT support

metadata.filename: 03_rdp_connection_issues.md

content:
For complex issues, chatbot automatically creates ticket with:
   - All diagnostic questions and answers
   - Error messages captured
   - Network information
   - Suggested priority (high if completely blocked)
   - Suggested troubleshooting steps already attempted For NOC/SysAdmin Team Receive automated ticket with all diagnostic data Check server status and logs Verify user's IP is whitelisted Check for network connectivity issues Review recent changes to RDP configuration

metadata.filename: 03_rdp_connection_issues.md

content:
If server issue: Restart RDP service If user issue: Provide remote support or phone guidance Common RDP Error Codes and Solutions Error: "The Remote Desktop Gateway server cannot be reached"
- Check internet connection
- Verify VPN is connected
- Restart router/modem Error: "Remote Desktop cannot connect to the remote computer"
- Verify correct server address
- Check firewall settings
- Ensure RDP service is running on server
- Verify credentials

metadata.filename: 03_rdp_connection_issues.md

content:
# User Addition and Deletion - Employee Onboarding/Offboarding - AceBuddy Knowledge Base Issue
New employee needs account creation or departing employee needs account removal. Symbols
**User Addition (Onboarding):**
- New employee hired
- Needs AceBuddy account
- Needs system access
- Starting date coming up **User Deletion (Offboarding):**
- Employee departure
- Need to disable account
- Remove access rights
- Archival of data

metadata.filename: 04_user_addition_deletion.md

content:
Chatbot collects information:
   - Full Name
   - Email Address (personal or company)
   - Customer ID (CID) or Account Number
   - Department/Role
   - Start Date
   - Manager Name
   - Access Level Required
   - Additional Systems Needed (QB, RDP, Email, etc.) Chatbot captures information into support ticket Chatbot confirms: "Sending user creation request to IT team"

metadata.filename: 04_user_addition_deletion.md

content:
Automated email sent to IT/HR with:
   - All user details
   - Start date
   - Required access levels
   - Manager approval reference User receives confirmation email with ticket number Expected turnaround: 1-2 business days **For User Deletion:** Chatbot collects information:
   - Employee Name
   - Last Working Date
   - Reason for Deletion (Resignation, Termination, Transfer, etc.)
   - Data Archival Required? (Yes/No)
   - Final access date
   - Manager Name/Approval

metadata.filename: 04_user_addition_deletion.md

content:
Chatbot captures information into support ticket Automated email sent to IT/HR with:
   - User details
   - Last working date
   - Archival requirements
   - Access removal timeline User receives confirmation email Expected turnaround: Completed by last working date For IT/HR Team Receive automated ticket from chatbot Verify all required information is present For additions:
   - Create user account
   - Set up email
   - Grant system access
   - Update employee directory

metadata.filename: 04_user_addition_deletion.md

content:
For deletions:
   - Archive user data if requested
   - Disable account
   - Revoke system access
   - Remove from distribution lists Send confirmation to requesting manager/HR Update ticket status Information Needed for User Addition
- Full Legal Name
- Email Address
- Employee ID/CID
- Department
- Job Title
- Manager Name
- Start Date
- Access Requirements (which systems)
- Equipment Needed (laptop, monitor, etc.)

metadata.filename: 04_user_addition_deletion.md

content:
# Monitor Setup - Single and Multi-Monitor Configuration - AceBuddy Knowledge Base Issue
User needs to set up monitors for Remote Desktop session or switch between single and multi-monitor configurations. Symptoms
- User wants to use multiple monitors with RDP
- Currently using single monitor, wants multi-monitor
- Multi-monitor not working in RDP session
- Display resolution issues
- Application windows not appearing on correct monitor

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content: Open **Remote Desktop Connection** (search for "mstsc" on your computer) Enter the RDP server address: [Your Company RDP Server] Click **Show Options** (bottom of dialog) Go to the **Display** tab Look for the option: "Use all my monitors for the remote session" **Check this box** to enable multi-monitor You can also set resolution to "Fill my monitors" Click **Connect** Your Remote Desktop session will now span across all connected monitors.

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content:
**Benefits of Multi-Monitor with RDP:**
- Increased workspace and productivity
- Can view multiple applications simultaneously
- Better use of screen real estate
- Improved workflow efficiency **For Single Monitor Setup:** Open **Remote Desktop Connection** (search for "mstsc") Click **Show Options** Go to **Display** tab Uncheck "Use all my monitors for the remote session" Set resolution to preferred single-monitor resolution Click **Connect**

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content:
Your Remote Desktop session will use only one monitor. Monitor Count Guide
- **Single Monitor**: Standard setup, adequate for most tasks
- **Dual Monitor** (2 monitors): Better for QB + communication + web browsing
- **Triple Monitor** (3+ monitors): Advanced setup for power users, specialized workflows

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content:
**Issue: Multi-monitor option not available**
- Solution: Update Remote Desktop client
- Download: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/2828362
- Restart RDP connection **Issue: Only one monitor shows up in RDP**
- Check all monitors are connected and powered on
- Verify all monitors detected by Windows (Settings  Display)
- Restart RDP connection
- May need to disable and re-enable in Display settings

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content:
**Issue: RDP session spans monitors incorrectly**
- Adjust monitor positions in Windows Display settings
- Windows  Settings  System  Display  Arrange displays
- Position monitors to match physical layout
- Reconnect RDP after arrangement **Issue: Performance degradation with multi-monitor**
- Multi-monitor = higher bandwidth requirements
- Consider reducing resolution
- Close unused applications
- Use Ethernet instead of WiFi for better performance
- Reduce remote desktop quality setting

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content:
Performance Optimization Use Ethernet connection (not WiFi) Keep network bandwidth available Close unnecessary applications Monitor network latency Reduce resolution if experiencing lag Remote Desktop Quality Settings
- **High Quality**: Slower, more details (local network)
- **Medium Quality**: Balanced (good for most setups)
- **Low Quality**: Fast, reduced details (slow networks)

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content: If multi-monitor fails: Auto-escalate to IT with system info Provide performance metrics if needed Follow up on user satisfaction Troubleshooting Verify Remote Desktop client is updated Check if monitors properly detected by Windows Try single monitor first, then enable multi-monitor Escalate to IT support with screenshot of Display settings

metadata.filename: 05_monitor_setup.md

content:
# Printer Not Working / Offline / Stuck - Printer Troubleshooting - AceBuddy Knowledge Base Issue
Printer is offline, cannot find printer, or print jobs are stuck/not printing. Symptoms
- "Printer not found" or "Printer offline" error
- Print job appears in queue but never prints
- Cannot add printer to system
- Printer appears offline in settings
- Print job stuck/pending indefinitely
- Printer not responding to print commands

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**Problem**: Printer shows as "Offline" in Windows settings **Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:** **Restart the printer**:
   - Locate power button on printer
   - Hold button or turn off for 10 seconds
   - Count to 10 while it shuts down
   - Turn back on and wait for startup (30-60 seconds) **Restart your computer**:
   - Save all work
   - Restart Windows completely
   - Wait for full startup
   - Try printing again

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**Check printer connection**:
   - Verify printer is connected to network (WiFi or Ethernet)
   - Look for WiFi/network icon on printer display
   - Note any error lights or messages on printer **Print a test page**:
   - Windows  Settings  Devices  Printers & Scanners
   - Select your printer
   - Click "Open queue"
   - Right-click  "Printer properties"
   - Click "Print Test Page"
   - Listen for printer response

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**If still offline:**
- Printer may need WiFi reconnection
- Check if WiFi password changed
- Restart WiFi router
- Contact IT support: "Escalating to IT team..." --- Solution B: Print Job Stuck **Problem**: Print job appears in queue but never prints, blocking other jobs **Quick Fix - 3 Minutes:**

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**Clear the print queue**:
   - Windows  Settings  Devices  Printers & Scanners
   - Click on your printer
   - Click "Open queue"
   - Look for stuck print job
   - Right-click on stuck job  "Cancel" **If queue won't clear**:
   - Press **Windows Key + R**
   - Type: `services.msc`
   - Find "Print Spooler"
   - Right-click  "Stop"
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Right-click  "Start" **Restart printer again**:
   - Power off for 10 seconds
   - Power back on
   - Try printing test page

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**Try printing again**:
   - Open document
   - File  Print
   - Select printer
   - Click "Print" **If job still stuck:**
- Printer may have hardware issue
- Contact IT support with printer name and model --- Solution C: Can't Find/Connect to Printer **Problem**: Printer not appearing in available printers list **Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:** **Verify printer is on network**:
   - Check printer power
   - Verify printer connected to WiFi or Ethernet
   - Look for network indicator on printer

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**Add printer to Windows**:
   - Windows  Settings  Devices  Printers & Scanners
   - Click "Add a printer or scanner"
   - Wait 30 seconds for scan
   - Look for your printer in the list
   - Click on it and "Add device" **If printer not found in scan**:
   - Try "The printer that I want isn't listed"
   - Select "Add a printer using an IP address or hostname"
   - Enter printer IP address: **[Check printer settings or ask IT for IP]**
   - Click Next and follow wizard

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**If still not found**:
   - Printer may need to be reset
   - Restart printer (power off 10 seconds, power on)
   - Wait 1 minute for network connection
   - Try adding again **If still not available:**
- Printer may need IT configuration
- Contact IT support: "Escalating to IT team..." --- Solution D: Printer Not Responding **Problem**: Printer appears connected but doesn't respond to print commands **Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:**

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**Verify printer status**:
   - Check printer display screen
   - Look for error lights (red, orange, blinking)
   - Note any error messages **Check for common issues**:
   - **Out of paper**: Refill paper tray
   - **Paper jam**: Open all access doors and remove jammed paper
   - **Toner/ink low**: Replace cartridge if indicated
   - **Door open**: Close all covers and access doors **Power cycle printer**:
   - Turn off for 10 seconds
   - Turn back on
   - Wait for startup complete

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
**Print test page** (from printer menu):
   - Use printer control panel buttons
   - Navigate to "Settings" or "Maintenance"
   - Select "Print Test Page" or "Test Print"
   - If test page prints, printer is working **If printer still not responding:**
- Hardware may be malfunctioning
- Contact IT support with error messages --- Printer Information Needed for IT Support What document you're trying to print --- Printer Maintenance Tips **Regular cleaning**: Keep printer clean from dust

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content: **Paper quality**: Use appropriate paper type/weight **Toner/ink**: Keep supplies stocked to avoid empty cartridge **Firmware updates**: Check for printer software updates monthly **Network connection**: Ensure stable network for printer ---

metadata.filename: 06_printer_troubleshooting.md

content:
# Server Performance Issues - CPU / RAM / Disk Full - AceBuddy Knowledge Base Issue
Server or computer is running slowly, freezing, or showing high resource usage. Symptoms
- Computer running slowly or freezing
- High CPU usage
- High RAM (memory) usage
- Low disk space
- Applications taking long time to load
- System becomes unresponsive periodically
- Fan running loudly
- Programs crashing or quitting unexpectedly

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
**Opening Task Manager:**
- Press **Ctrl + Shift + Esc** (fastest method)
- Or: Right-click taskbar  "Task Manager"
- Or: Press **Ctrl + Alt + Delete**  Click "Task Manager" --- Diagnostic Questions and Solutions Question 1: CPU Usage
**Chatbot asks**: "What is your CPU usage percentage? (Look at 'Performance' tab, 'CPU')" **If CPU < 50%**: Normal, not the issue

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
**If CPU 50-80%**: Moderately high
- Solution:
  1. Look at "Processes" tab
  2. Find processes using high CPU (look at "CPU" column)
  3. If unknown application: Close it
  4. If critical application: Try closing and reopening
  5. Restart computer

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
**If CPU > 80%**: High (causing slowness)
- Solution:
  1. Go to "Processes" tab
  2. Sort by CPU column (click header)
  3. Close non-critical applications
  4. Close web browsers (Chrome uses significant CPU)
  5. Disable background applications
  6. If issue persists: Restart computer **If CPU stays high after closing apps:**
- Potential malware or system issue
- Contact IT support
- System may need antivirus scan ---

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
**If RAM > 85%**: Critical (causing system slowness)
- Solution:
  1. Save all work immediately
  2. Close all non-critical applications
  3. Close web browsers completely
  4. Restart your computer
  5. After restart, your memory will be cleared **If memory usage high even after restart:**
- Application may have memory leak
- Contact IT support
- May need to reinstall problematic application ---

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
**If Disk > 95%**: Critical (system will slow down severely)
- Solution:
  1. Immediately stop any new file creation
  2. Move large files to external drive (if available)
  3. Delete unnecessary files aggressively
  4. Delete installer files (.exe, .msi files)
  5. Uninstall unused applications
  6. Contact IT: "I need a disk upgrade urgently" **Check disk space:**
- Click "This PC" in Windows File Explorer
- Right-click your C: drive
- Click "Properties"
- See "Used space" vs "Free space" ---

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
Complete Diagnostic Process **User Provides All Three Metrics:** **All normal (CPU <50%, RAM <60%, Disk <85%)**
   - System should be running fine
   - Slowness may be caused by:
     - Network latency
     - Software issue (QB, application bug)
     - Background processes
   - Chatbot suggests: "Restart your computer and monitor performance" **One metric high**
   - CPU high: Close applications, restart
   - RAM high: Close applications, restart
   - Disk high: Delete files, request upgrade

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
**Multiple metrics high**
   - Indicates system is overloaded
   - Solution: Restart computer immediately
   - Close unused applications after restart
   - If problem persists: Contact IT support --- Recommended Actions by Combination

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
| CPU | RAM | Disk | Recommended Action |
|-----|-----|------|-------------------|
| Low | Low | Low | Everything normal |
| High | Low | Low | Close CPU-heavy apps, restart |
| Low | High | Low | Close applications, restart |
| Low | Low | High | Delete files, request upgrade |
| High | High | Low | Restart computer |
| High | Low | High | Restart, then delete files |
| Low | High | High | Restart, close apps, delete files |

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
High | High | Restart, close apps, delete files |
| High | High | High | Restart immediately, aggressive cleanup needed |

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content: --- Prevention Tips **For CPU Issues:** Limit number of applications running Keep Windows updated Run antivirus scans regularly Close web browser when not in use **For RAM Issues:** Restart computer regularly (weekly) Close unused applications Limit web browser tabs (each = memory) Consider RAM upgrade if frequent issues **For Disk Issues:** Archive old files regularly Delete temporary files monthly Clean up Downloads folder Request upgrade before reaching 90% --- When to Escalate to IT Support

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
- CPU high after closing all applications
- RAM high immediately after restart
- Disk > 95% and no files to delete
- System still slow after troubleshooting
- Performance affecting work productivity
- Error messages appearing
- System crashes or freezes frequently --- Expected Outcome
- 60-70% of performance issues resolved by user
- User understands their system resources
- Clear escalation path for complex issues
- IT receives diagnostic data upfront
- Reduced support tickets through prevention

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content: Troubleshooting Document resource metrics when issue occurs Note which applications are running Check for recently installed software Verify no malware present Contact IT with complete diagnostic data

metadata.filename: 07_server_performance.md

content:
# QuickBooks (QB) Issues - Won't Start / Bank Feed / File Corrupt - AceBuddy Knowledge Base Issue
QuickBooks won't start, bank feed not syncing, or company file is corrupted. Symptoms
- QuickBooks won't open or crashes on startup
- "QuickBooks is not responding" error
- Bank feeds not syncing with accounts
- Transactions missing from bank feed
- Company file won't open / error message
- File appears corrupted or damaged
- Slow performance in QB
- Cannot access company data

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
Solution A: QuickBooks Won't Start / Crashes on Startup **Problem**: QB won't open or crashes immediately after launching **Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Restart your computer**:
   - Save all work in other applications
   - Restart Windows completely
   - Wait for full startup (2-3 minutes)
   - Try opening QuickBooks again

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Check internet connection**:
   - QB requires active internet connection
   - Verify WiFi or Ethernet is connected
   - Try visiting a website to confirm connectivity
   - Restart WiFi router if needed **Restart QuickBooks**:
   - Close QB if open
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Open QB again
   - Give it 30 seconds to load **Update QuickBooks**:
   - Open QB
   - Go to **Help** menu
   - Click **Update QuickBooks**
   - Install all available updates
   - Restart QB

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Check QB company file**:
   - If QB opens but specific company won't load:
   - Try opening different company file (if available)
   - If other files open: Problem is with that specific file
   - If no files open: Problem is with QB installation **If QB still won't start:**
- QB installation may be corrupted
- Contact IT support: "QB won't start after troubleshooting" --- Solution B: Bank Feed Not Syncing **Problem**: Bank feed not updating or transactions not appearing from bank

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Check feed settings**:
   - Open QB company file
   - Go to **Banking** menu
   - Click **My Bank Feeds**
   - Verify feed is **connected** (green status)
   - If red status: Click **Connect** **Force feed sync**:
   - Go to **Banking**  **My Bank Feeds**
   - Click on the feed
   - Click **Download New Transactions**
   - Wait 1-2 minutes for download

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Verify account connection**:
   - Go to **Banking**  **My Bank Feeds**
   - Check that correct bank account is connected
   - Verify login credentials for bank
   - If wrong account: Delete feed and re-add **Check bank settings**:
   - Login to your bank's website
   - Verify QB is authorized to access your account
   - Check if you need to approve QB connection
   - Re-authorize if needed

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Wait and try again**:
   - Bank syncs may take 24-48 hours
   - Don't delete duplicate transactions immediately
   - Wait a day to see if transactions appear
   - Then reconcile and delete duplicates **If feed still not syncing:**
- Bank connection issue
- Chatbot creates support ticket with:
  - Bank name
  - Account type (checking, savings, credit card)
  - Last successful sync date
  - Error messages (if any) --- Solution C: Company File Corrupted / Won't Open

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Problem**: File appears damaged, won't open, or gives error message **Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Try opening from backup**:
   - Ask: Do you have a recent backup of this file?
   - If yes: Open the backup file from backup location
   - Try making it your working file if backup works **Try opening in Safe Mode**:
   - Open QB
   - Open the company file
   - If error appears: Click "Open in Safe Mode"
   - This disables some features but may recover file

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Restart QB and computer**:
   - Close QB and all applications
   - Restart computer completely
   - Open QB and try file again **Validate/Rebuild file**:
   - Open QB
   - Go to **File** menu
   - Click **Utilities**  **Validate/Rebuild Data**
   - This checks and repairs file integrity
   - QB will restart and rebuild file

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Check company file location**:
   - Verify file is on local hard drive (not shared network)
   - Avoid network file sharing (causes corruption)
   - Make copy to local drive and work from there **If file still corrupted:**
- File may need professional recovery
- Contact IT support with:
  - File location and name
  - When file became corrupted
  - Any error messages
  - Last backup date --- Solution D: Login / Authentication Issues

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Problem**: Cannot log in to QB or getting authentication errors **Quick Fix - 5 Minutes:** **Verify account login**:
   - Confirm username/email is correct
   - Verify password is correct (passwords are case-sensitive)
   - Try resetting password if unsure **Check internet connection**:
   - QB requires internet for login
   - Verify connectivity before attempting login
   - Restart WiFi if needed

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
**Clear cached credentials**:
   - Close QB
   - Go to Windows Settings  Accounts  Credentials Manager
   - Remove any stored QB credentials
   - Restart QB and log in again **Update QB if needed**:
   - Go to **Help**  **Update QuickBooks**
   - Install all updates
   - Sometimes updates fix authentication issues **If still cannot login:**
- Account may be locked or suspended
- Contact QB support or your account administrator --- Information Needed for IT Support

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
Today, this week, etc.
- **Recent changes**: Any updates, network changes, etc.
- **Steps already tried**: What troubleshooting you've done
- **Backup available**: Is there a recent backup --- Prevention Tips **For QB Stability:** Keep QB updated with latest patches Restart QB once per week Run verification/rebuild monthly Keep antivirus updated Use uninterruptible power supply (UPS) **For Bank Feed Reliability:** Reconcile transactions promptly Don't delete unreconciled transactions

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
Update bank credentials if changed Monitor feed status weekly **For File Integrity:** Store company file on local drive Regular backups (daily minimum) Don't share file over network Use single-user mode when possible Keep QB installed on local drive --- Expected Outcome
- 50-60% of QB issues resolved by user in 5-15 minutes
- File corruption issues escalated with diagnostic info
- IT receives complete problem description
- Backup restores minimize data loss
- Minimal disruption to accounting work

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content: Verify adequate hard drive space Ensure QB is fully updated Run disk cleanup and optimization Contact QB support with complete diagnostic data

metadata.filename: 08_quickbooks_issues.md

content:
# Email Issues - Outlook Configuration and Sync Problems - AceBuddy Knowledge Base Issue
Email not working in Outlook, can't send/receive messages, or experiencing sync problems. Symptoms
- Outlook won't open
- Cannot send emails
- Cannot receive emails
- Email sync not working
- "Cannot connect to server" error
- Login error or authentication failed
- Outlook crashes or freezes
- Email stuck in outbox
- Settings or mailbox empty

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
Chatbot asks: "What email issue are you experiencing?"
   - Can't send emails
   - Can't receive emails
   - Login/authentication error
   - Outlook crashes or won't open
   - Sync not working
   - Other issue --- Solution A: Cannot Receive Emails **Problem**: Emails not coming into Outlook inbox **Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Check internet connection**:
   - Verify WiFi or Ethernet is connected
   - Try visiting a website to confirm connectivity
   - Outlook requires active internet to sync

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Check account configuration**:
   - Open Outlook
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Select your email account
   - Click **Change** or **Repair**
   - Verify email address and password are correct **Check mailbox connection**:
   - Go to **Send / Receive** tab
   - Click **Send / Receive All**
   - Wait 30 seconds for sync
   - Check if emails arrive

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Check inbox rules**:
   - Go to **Home** tab  **Rules**  **Manage Rules & Alerts**
   - Look for any rules that might be blocking emails
   - Verify no rules are redirecting emails to another folder
   - Disable suspicious rules temporarily

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Check server settings**:
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Select your email account
   - Click **Change**
   - Verify incoming server settings:
     - Server type: IMAP or POP3 (ask IT which one)
     - Server address: (should be provided by IT)
     - Port: 993 (IMAP) or 995 (POP3)
     - Encryption: SSL/TLS **Restart Outlook**:
   - Close Outlook completely
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Open Outlook again
   - Check inbox again

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**If emails still not receiving:**
- Server connection issue
- Server may be down
- Contact IT support --- Solution B: Cannot Send Emails **Problem**: Can receive emails but cannot send **Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Check outbox**:
   - Open Outlook
   - Go to **Outbox** folder
   - Check if emails are stuck in outbox
   - If emails there: Try **Send / Receive All**

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Clear stuck emails**:
   - If email still stuck in outbox:
   - Right-click email
   - Click **Delete**
   - Start fresh with new email **Check outgoing server settings**:
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Select your email account
   - Click **Change**
   - Verify outgoing server settings:
     - SMTP server address: (provided by IT)
     - Port: 587 or 25
     - Encryption: StartTLS or SSL/TLS
     - Authentication: Required (with your email/password)

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Verify authentication**:
   - Ensure "Require Authentication" is checked
   - Verify username and password are correct
   - If password recently changed: Update here **Test send**:
   - Create new email to yourself
   - Send it
   - Check if email arrives in inbox in 30 seconds **If still cannot send:**
- Outgoing server may be down
- Port may be blocked
- Contact IT support: "Cannot send emails from Outlook" --- Solution C: Login / Authentication Error

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Problem**: Cannot log in to email or getting authentication errors **Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Verify credentials**:
   - Confirm email address is correct
   - Confirm password is correct (case-sensitive)
   - Verify no CAPS LOCK is on
   - Try password reset if unsure

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Add account again**:
   - Go to **File**  **Account Settings**  **Account Settings**
   - Click your email account
   - Click **Delete**
   - Confirm deletion
   - Click **New** to add account again
   - Enter email and password
   - Let Outlook auto-configure if possible **Check for old password**:
   - Password recently changed?
   - Outlook may still have old password stored
   - Delete account and re-add with new password

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Verify multi-factor authentication (MFA)**:
   - Some accounts require MFA
   - If using MFA: May need app-specific password
   - Contact IT for app-specific password if required
   - Use app password instead of regular password **Clear password cache**:
   - Go to Windows **Control Panel**  **Credential Manager**
   - Remove any stored Outlook/email credentials
   - Restart Outlook
   - Enter credentials fresh

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**If still cannot authenticate:**
- Account may be locked
- Contact IT support: "Cannot log in to email" --- Solution D: Outlook Crashes or Won't Open **Problem**: Outlook crashes on startup or freezes frequently **Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Restart Outlook**:
   - Close Outlook if open
   - Wait 10 seconds
   - Open Outlook again **Restart computer**:
   - Save all work
   - Restart Windows completely
   - Open Outlook again

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Disable add-ins**:
   - Outlook add-ins can cause crashes
   - Start Outlook in Safe Mode:
     - Hold CTRL while starting Outlook
     - Accept "Safe Mode" prompt
   - If Outlook works in Safe Mode: Problematic add-in exists
   - Contact IT to disable add-in **Check for updates**:
   - Go to **File**  **Office Account**
   - Click **Update Options**  **Update Now**
   - Install all available updates
   - Restart Outlook

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Try repairing Outlook**:
   - Go to **Control Panel**  **Programs**  **Programs and Features**
   - Find "Microsoft Office" or "Outlook"
   - Click it and select **Repair** or **Change**
   - Choose **Quick Repair** first
   - If that fails: Try **Online Repair**
   - Restart computer after repair **If Outlook still crashes:**
- Installation may be corrupted
- Contact IT support: "Outlook keeps crashing" --- Solution E: Email Sync Not Working

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Problem**: Emails not syncing between devices or recent emails missing **Quick Fix - 5-10 Minutes:** **Force sync**:
   - Open Outlook
   - Go to **Send / Receive** tab
   - Click **Send / Receive All**
   - Wait 1-2 minutes **Check sync settings**:
   - Go to **File**  **Options**  **Advanced**
   - Look for **Sync and Offline Settings**
   - Verify "Sync Email" is enabled
   - Check sync folder settings

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Check folder settings**:
   - Right-click your email account
   - Click **Folder Properties**
   - Verify folder is set to sync
   - For IMAP: Check if specific folders are syncing **Increase sync time range**:
   - Go to **File**  **Options**  **Advanced**
   - Look for sync settings
   - Change to sync "All" emails (not just last 3 months)

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
**Clear offline cache**:
   - Close Outlook
   - Delete outlook.ost file:
     - Go to: C:\Users\[YourUsername]\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Outlook
     - Find outlook.ost file
     - Delete it
   - Restart Outlook
   - Wait for new .ost file to download **If sync still not working:**
- Server sync issue
- Contact IT support: "Email not syncing" --- Information Needed for IT Support

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
(Outlook.com, Office 365, Gmail, Corporate, etc.)
- **Device and OS**: (Windows, Mac, which version)
- **Outlook version**: Go to File  Office Account to see version
- **Error message**: Any specific error text
- **When problem started**: Today, this week, after update, etc.
- **Steps already tried**: What troubleshooting completed
- **Other devices**: Does email work on other devices (phone, tablet, etc.) --- Prevention Tips Keep Outlook updated Maintain strong password Enable MFA if available

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content:
Disable untrusted add-ins Regularly clear old emails Archive emails for better performance Restart Outlook weekly --- Expected Outcome
- 60-70% of email issues resolved by user
- Complex issues escalated with diagnostic information
- Email restored within 15-30 minutes for most issues
- Improved productivity with working email
- Prevention tips reduce future issues

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content: Document all error messages Check email works on other devices Verify IT server settings Check firewall blocking email ports Contact IT support with complete diagnostic data

metadata.filename: 09_email_issues.md

content: Password Reset Instructions Go to the login page and click "Forgot Password" Enter your email address associated with your account Check your email for a password reset link Click the link and create a new password Use your new password to log in Ensure you're using the correct email address For additional help, contact support at support@acebuddy.com or chat with us. Check your internet connection Verify the server name is correct Ensure you have the correct username and password

metadata.filename: acebuddy_support_guide.txt

content:
Try restarting the Remote Desktop application Check if the server is online and accessible Check internet connection and firewall settings Contact IT support if the issue persists. - Update bank connection settings
- Re-enter bank login credentials
- Check with your bank for service outages
- Clear browser cache if using web connect For technical support, contact our QuickBooks specialists.
